intro: Rondeletia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
